inclusion.criterion: female sex, PV and BNP at baseline were correlated with AS progression
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: increased progression was present in those with resting mean gradient (MG) >35 mmHg
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: strain gradually decreased as severity of AS increases and that global longitudinal strain (GLS)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: longitudinal, radial and circumferential strain and strain rate (SR) deteriorate with aortic valve disease progression
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Progression rates begin from 0.15±0.01 m/s/y in population without cardiovascular risk factors
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: High progressors are those that have at least one abnormal parameter of the followings: echocardiography parameters
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: clinical predictors: CAD, age (>80 years), diabetes, metabolic syndrome (MS)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: biological parameters: parathyroid hormone (PTH) level, BNP at baseline, high lipoprotein (a) and low density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol levels
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: No influence on AS progression were treatment with simvastatin and ezetimibe
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Slower progression was observed after osteoporosis and bisphosphonate treatment
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: positive stress test (symptoms including dyspnoea, angina, syncope, ECG pathological changes, WMA)
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a history of CAD, CHF, obesity hypoventilation syndrome, obstructive sleep apnea, DM2, ventricular tachycardia, hypothyroidism, schizophrenia, COPD, and Pneumonia. Patient is on BiPap at night and has been compliant with medication.
